article:
The table below lists initialisms and acronyms in common and current usage by
members of the Information Technology community. These acronyms are used to
discuss LAN, internet, WAN, routing and switching protocols, and their
applicable organizations. {{Cite book
| first = Todd last = Lammle title = CCNA IOS Commands publisher = Wiley
| Publishing, Inc year = 2008 ISBN = 978-1-58720-182-0}} {{Cite book
| first = Wendell last = Odem title = CCENT/CCNA ICND1 Official Exam
| Certification Guide, Second Edition publisher = Cisco Press year = 2008 ISBN =
| 978-0-470-17560-6 }} {{Cite book title = CCNA Exploration 4.0 5.0
| Routing Protocols and Concepts Student Lab Manual publisher = Cisco Press
}} The table contains only current, common, non-proprietary acronyms that
are specific to Information Technology. Most of these acronyms appear in IT
career certification exams.

{| class="wikitable sortable" border="1"
|-
! scope="col" width="12%" | Acronym scope="col" class="unsortable" width="40%" |
! Meaning scope="col" width="22%" | Primary Applicability The ISO model is
! used for layer names. scope="col" width="26%" | Normative Reference
|- ACK Acknowledgement Transport and other layers TCP/IP, for example. RFC 793 -
|ACL Access control list Security, application layer Access control list, [http-
|://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/11_3/security/configuration/guide/scacls.html
|Cisco overview] - ADSL Asymmetric digital subscriber line Telecom [http://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-
|G.992.5/en ITU-T G.992.5 Annex M], for example - AES Advanced Encryption
|Standard Security [http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/fips/fips197/fips-197.pdf
|U.S. FIPS PUB 197] - ANSI American National Standards Institute Organization
|[http://www.ansi.org/ ANSI] - ARP Address Resolution Protocol Link layer RFC
|1122 - ATM Asynchronous Transfer Mode Telecom [http://www.cisco.com/univercd/c-
|c/td/doc/product/atm/c8540/12_0/13_19/trouble/cells.htm ATM cell description] -
|BGP Border Gateway Protocol (routing protocol) Application layer, Routers RFC
|4271 - BSS Basic service set (Wi-Fi) Wireless [http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE
|Std 802.11-2007] - CAT Category (e.g. CAT-5 cable) Physical layer
|[http://www.tiaonline.org ANSI/TIA/EIA-568-B.1-2001] - CCITT (obs.) Standards
|organization that has been replaced by ITU-T Organization [http://www.itu.int
|ITU-T] - CHAP Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (PPP) Security,
|telecom RFC 1994 - CIDR Classless Inter-Domain Routing Architecture RFC 1518
|RFC 1519 - CIR Committed Information Rate (Frame Relay) Telecom RFC 1490 RFC
|1973 RFC 2427 - CLI Command line interpreter Hardware [http://www.cisco.com/en-
|/US/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/catos/7.x/command/reference/cli.html
|Catalyst 6500 Series Command Reference, 7.6], for example - CPE Customer
|premises equipment Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=6754 Telecom Glossary] - CRC
|Cyclical redundancy check Link and other layers 24 References here. - CRC-16-
|CCITT Cyclical redundancy check (X.25, HDLC) Link layers Reference on CRC page.
|- CSMA/CA Carrier sense multiple access / collision avoidance Wireless
|[http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE Std 802.11]
|[http://standards.ieee.org/getieee802/802.11.html Downloads] - CSMA/CD Carrier
|sense multiple access / collision detection Physical layer
|[http://standards.ieee.org/getieee802/802.3.html IEEE Std 802.3TM-2002] -
|CSU/DSU Channel service unit / data service unit Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=6201 Telecom Glossary] - DCE
|Data communications equipment Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=7003 Telecom Glossary] - DEC
|(obs.) Digital Equipment Corporation Organization Purchased by Compaq in 1998.
|Merged with Hewlett-Packard 2002. - DES Data Encryption Standard (obs. See AES)
|Security [http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/fips/fips46-3/fips46-3.pdf Federal
|Information Processing Standard (FIPS) FIPS-46-3] - DHCP Dynamic Host
|Configuration Protocol Application layer, Internet Layer RFC 2131 and others -
|DNS Domain Name System Application layer Over 30 RFCs here. - DRAM Dynamic random-
|access memory Hardware
|
|- DSL Digital Subscriber Line Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=7244 Telecom Glossary] - DSLAM
|Digital Subscriber Line Access Muliplexor Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=8598 Telecom Glossary
|(proposed)] - DTE Data Terminal Equipment Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=7452 Telecom Glossary] - EHA
|Ethernet Hardware Address (MAC address) Link layer [http://standards.ieee.org/getieee802/download/802-
|2001.pdf IEEE Std 802] [http://standards.ieee.org/regauth/oui/index.shtml IEEE
|OUI Assignments] - EIA Electronics Industry Alliance Organization
|[http://www.ecaus.org/eia/site/index.html EIA] - EIGRP Enhanced Interior
|Gateway Routing Protocol Internet Layer [http://www.cisco.com/en/US/tech/tk365-
|/technologies_white_paper09186a0080094cb7.shtml#feasibleandreported Cisco Doc
|ID: 16406] - EOF End Of Frame (HDLC, etc.) Link layer HDLC framing - ESS
|Extended service set (Wi-Fi group) Wireless [http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE
|Std 802.11-2007] - FCC Federal Communications Commission (US) Organization
|[http://www.fcc.gov/ US FCC] - FCS Frame check sequence (Ethernet) Link layer
|Ethernet Frame [http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/802/3/ IEEE Std 802.3] - FDDI
|Fiber Distributed Data Interface Link layer [http://www.ansi.org/ American
|National Standards Institute] X3T9.5 (now X3T12),
|[http://www.iso.org/iso/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=16977 ISO/IEC 9314-x] -
|FTP File Transfer Protocol Application layer RFC 959 and others - GBIC Gigabit
|interface converter Hardware [ftp://ftp.seagate.com/sff/INF-8053.PDF Seagate
|Specification] - Gbps Gigabit per second Physical layer Gigabit per second -
|HDLC High-level Data Link Control Link layer
|[http://www.iso.org/iso/search.htm?qt=13239&published=on&active_tab=standards
|ISO 13239] - http HyperText Transfer Protocol Application layer
|[http://www.w3.org/Protocols/History.html W3C Change History for HTTP] - https
|HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure Transport and other layers [http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-tls-ssl-version3-
|00 SSL 3.0 Specification] - IANA Internet Assigned Number Authority
|Organization [http://www.iana.org/ IANA] - ICMP Internet Control Message
|Protocol Internet Layer RFC 792 - IDF Intermediate distribution frame Physical
|layer Structured cabling or
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definitionsList.aspx?find=idf&kw=1 Telecom
|Glossary] - IDS Intrusion Detection System Security
|[http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/cc/pd/sqsw/sqidsz/index.shtml Cisco Product
|Index] - IEC Commission Electrotechnique Internationale (French) Organization
|[http://www.iec.ch/ IEC] - IEEE Institute for Electrical and Electronic
|Engineers Organization [http://ieee.org/index.html IEEE] - IETF Internet
|Engineering Task Force Organization [http://www.ietf.org IETF] - IMAP Internet
|Message Access Protocol Application layer RFC 3501 - IP Internet Protocol
|Internet Layer RFC 791 RFC 1606 - IPS Intrusion prevention system Security [http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-94/SP800-
|94.pdf "NIST - Guide to Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDPS)". 2007-
|02. Retrieved 2010-08-24.] - IS-IS Intermediate System to Intermediate System
|(routing protocol) Internet Layer
|[http://webstore.iec.ch/preview/info_isoiec10589%7Bed2.0%7Den.pdf ISO/IEC
|10589:2002] - ISDN Integrated Services Digital Network Telecom
|[http://std.iec.ch/iev/iev.nsf/index?openform&part=716 IEC Area 716-xx] - ISP
|Internet service provider Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=4378 Telecom Glossary] - ITU-T
|International Telecommunications Union Organization http://www.itu.int - kbps
|Kilobit per second Physical layer Kilobit_per_second - LAN Local area network
|Link and other layers [http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=4066
|Telecom Glossary] - LAPB Link Access Procedure, Balanced (x.25) Telecom [http://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-
|X.222/en/ ITU-T Recommendation X.222] - LAPF Link-access procedure for frame
|relay Telecom RFC 1490 - LLC Logical link control Link layer
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=4209 Telecom Glossary] - MAC
|Media access control Link layer [http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/802/3/ IEEE Std
|802.3] and [http://grouper.ieee.org/groups/802/11/ 802.11], for example - MAN
|Metropolitan area network Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=3922 Telecom Glossary] - Mbps
|Megabits per second Physical layer Megabit_per_second - MC Multiple choice IT
|Professional Certification [http://www.cisco.com/web/learning/le3/le11/learnin-
|g_about_certification_exams.html About certification exams] - MDF Main
|distribution frame Physical layer
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definitionsList.aspx?find=mdf&kw=1 Glossary] See
|also Structured cabling - MIB Management information base (SNMP) Application
|layer RFC 3418 - MPLS Multiprotocol Label Switching network technology
|
|- MTU Maximum Transmission Unit Multiple layers
|
|- NAC Network access control Link and other layers [http://standards.ieee.org/getieee802/download/802.1X-
|2004.pdf IEEE 802.1x] - NAT Network Address Translation Internet Layer [http://www.cisco.com/web/about/ac123/ac147/archived_issues/ipj_7-
|3/anatomy.html Cisco Internet Protocol Journal: A look Inside Network Address
|Translators] - NBMA Non-Broadcast Multiple Access (e.g. Frame Relay ATM)
|Telecom See ATM, Frame Relay and X.25, for examples. - NIC Network Interface
|Card Physical layer [http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=3535
|Telecom Glossary] - NRZ Non-return-to-zero Physical layer [http://www.its.bldrdoc.gov/fs-1037/fs-
|1037c.htm Federal Standard 1037C] - NRZI Non-return to zero inverted Physical
|layer [http://www.its.bldrdoc.gov/fs-1037/fs-1037c.htm Federal Standard 1037C]
|- NVRAM Non-volatile RAM Hardware Sample vendor data
|[http://www.st.com/stonline/products/families/memories/nvram/nv_ind.htm here] -
|OSI Open System Interconnect (joint ISO and ITU standard) Organization [http:/-
|/www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=43795
|ISO/IEC 9594-5:2005] Open Systems Interconnection Protocol Specifications -
|OSPF Open Shortest Path First (routing protocol) Internet Layer RFC 2238 - OUI
|Organization Unique Identifier Link and other layers
|[http://standards.ieee.org/regauth/oui/index.shtml IEEE OUI Assignments] - PAP
|Password authentication protocol Security RFC 1334 - PAT Port address
|translation Internet Layer RFC 1918 - PC Personal computer (host) Hardware
|
|- PCM Pulse-code modulation Physical layer [http://www.itu.int/net/itu-
|t/sigdb/speaudio/Gseries.htm ITU-T G.711] - PDU Protocol data unit (such as
|segment, packet, frame, etc.) Multiple layers [http://www.its.bldrdoc.gov/fs-1037/fs-
|1037c.htm Fed Std 1037C] - POP3 Post Office Protocol, version 3 Application
|layer RFC 1939 - POP Point of presence Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=2926 Telecom Glossary] - POST
|Power-on self test Hardware
|[https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/lan/catalyst2800/ug/fs28inst.html
|Cisco Catalyst 2800 User Guide], for example - POTS Plain old telephone service
|Telecom [http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=2902 Telecom Glossary]
|- PPP Point-to-point Protocol Telecom RFC 1661 - PPTP Point-to-Point Tunneling
|Protocol Telecom RFC 2637 - PTT Public Telephone and Telegraph Telecom
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=2756 Telecom Glossary] or
|[http://acronyms.thefreedictionary.com/Public+Telephone+%26+Telegraph Free
|Dictionary] - PVST Per-VLAN Spanning Tree Link layer [http://www.cisco.com/en/-
|US/tech/tk389/tk621/tsd_technology_support_protocol_home.html Cisco's
|introduction to Spanning Tree Protocol] - RADIUS Remote Authentication Dial-In
|User Service Security RFC 2865 - RAM Random Access Memory Physical layer
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=2187 Telecom Glossary] - RARP
|Reverse ARP Link layer RFC 903 - RFC Request for Comments Multiple layers [http://www.ietf.org/download/rfc-
|index.txt IETF's RFC Index] - RIP Routing Information Protocol Internet Layer
|RFC 2453, for RIP version 2 - RLL Run-Length Limited Physical layer RLL is used
|in a wide range of encodings. - ROM Read-Only Memory Hardware
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=2069 Telecom Glossary] - RSTP
|Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol Link layer
|[http://www.ieee802.org/1/pages/802.1w.html IEEE 802.1w] - Rapid
|Reconfiguration of Spanning Tree - RTP Real-time Transport Protocol Application
|layer RFC 3550 - SDLC Synchronous Data Link Control Link layer [http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/internetworking/technology/handbook/SDLC-
|etc.html Cisco Technology Handbook: SDLC and Derivatives] - SFD Start-of-frame
|delimiter (Ethernet, HDLC, etc.) Link layer
|[http://www.ieee802.org/3/index.html IEEE 802.3 (Ethernet)], or RFC 2687
|(HDLC), for examples - SFP Small form-factor pluggable Hardware [ftp://ftp.seagate.com/sff/INF-
|8074.PDFS Seagate Specification] - S-HTTP Secure HTTP (rarely used) Transport
|and other layers RFC 2660 See also https - SLARP Serial Line ARP (Address
|Resolution Protocol) Link and other layers [http://securitydigest.org/tcp-
|ip/archive/1990/11#000068 Archived Cisco Serial Line Encapulation extension] -
|SLIP Serial Line Internet Protocol (obs.) Telecom RFC 1055 - SMTP Simple Mail
|Transfer Protocol Application layer RFC 5321 - SNA Systems Network Architecture
|(IBM) Multiple layers [http://www.protocols.com/pbook/sna.htm SNA Protocol
|Suite] - SNAP SubNet Access Protocol Link layer [http://standards.ieee.org/getieee802/download/802-
|2001.pdf IEEE 802 Overview and Architecture] - SNMP Simple Network Management
|Protocol Application layer RFC 1155, RFC 3410 thru RFC 3418 and others - SOF
|Start of frame Link layer [http://www.ieee802.org/3/index.html IEEE 802.3
|(Ethernet)], or RFC 2687 (HDLC), for examples - SRAM Static random access
|memory Hardware [http://www.pcguide.com/ref/ram/typesSRAM-c.html PC Guide's
|Definition] - SSH Secure shell Application layer RFC 4252 - SSID Service set
|identifier (Wi-Fi) Wireless [http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE 802.11] - STP
|Spanning Tree Protocol Link layer [http://www.cisco.com/en/US/tech/tk389/tk621-
|/tsd_technology_support_protocol_home.html Cisco's Introduction to Spanning
|Tree Protocol] - SYN (TCP) Synchronization Link and other layers RFC 793 and
|many others - TCP/IP Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol Transport
|layer RFC 793 and many others - TDM Time-division multiplexing Physical layer
|[http://www.its.bldrdoc.gov/fs-1037/ Fed Std 1037C] - TFTP Trivial File
|Transfer Protocol Application layer RFC 1350 - TIA Telecommunications Industry
|Alliance Organization [http://www.tiaonline.org/ Telecommunications Industry
|Association] - UDP User Datagram Protocol Transport layer RFC 768 - USB
|Universal Serial Bus Physical and other layers
|[http://www.usb.org/developers/docs/ USB 3.0 Specification] - UTP Unshielded
|twisted pair Physical Many versions are defined by TIA, such as: [http://www.t-
|iaonline.org/standards/catalog/search.cfm?standards_criteria=TIA/EIA-568 TIA-568-
|B] - VC Virtual circuit Transport and other layers
|[http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=240 Telecom Glossary] - VLAN
|Virtual local area network Link layer [http://www.ieee802.org/1/pages/802.1Q-
|rev.html IEEE 802.1Q] - VLSM Variable-length subnet masking Architecture RFC
|1518 RFC 1519 - VPN Virtual private network Application layer [http://www.vpnc.org/vpn-
|standards.html Virtual Private Network Consortium] - W3C World Wide Web
|Consortium Organization [http://www.w3.org/ W3C] - WAN Wide-area network
|Telecom [http://www.atis.org/glossary/definition.aspx?id=287 Telecom Glossary]
|- WEP Wired Equivalent Privacy Wireless [http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE
|802.11] - Wi-Fi IEEE 802.11 (Wi-Fi Alliance) Wireless [http://www.wi-fi.org/
|Wi-Fi Alliance] - WPA Wi-Fi Protected Access Security
|[http://www.ieee802.org/11/ IEEE 802.11i] - www World Wide Web Architecture
|[http://www.w3.org/ W3C Consortium] }
